snippet: There have been 17 years in a row of increases, but last year's was 4 cents, or 0.5 percent.
abstract: There have been 17 years in a row of increases, but last year's was 4 cents, or 0.5 percent.
lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES - As usual, the average movie ticket in the United States cost more last year, but not by much. The National Association of Theater Owners said the average ticket price for 2011 was $7.93, up about 0.5 percent from $7.89 in 2010.

headline.main: Average Cost of a Movie Ticket Edges Up to $7.93
